adjectives.description: irredentist (comparative more irredentist, superlative most irredentist)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to irredentists or their policies.
examples: In 1885, a Bulgarian irredentist movement seized control of neighbouring Ottoman-ruled Eastern Roumelia and announced the creation of a Greater Bulgaria.

entries.meaning: Someone who calls for the seizure or recovery of territories or states currently subject to other countries; an adherent of irredentism.
examples: As the assassination of Sadat proved, the Arab irredentists, like the Zionist ultras, have always been unerring in picking off any incipient mediators.
